name: Empirical methods
tagline: Repository of scripts and data related to the Empirical Methods Session at SMT St. Louis 2015
body:
# SMT 2015 in St. Louis

Here you can find the data and code for the empirical methods workshop at SMT 2015 (held on Friday night, 7:30-10:30).

## Code

Scripts here can be downloaded and used in the terminal or in `R` (it is recommended that you download `RStudio` if you'd like to play with the R scripts). Shell scripts (those ending in `.sh`) can be run in the terminal by typing the following in the Terminal application:

* ./script_name.sh


## Data

Data are available here as kern files. This format can be read in Humdrum (which we will be using in the workshop), but also in music21 with the kern translator (see [music21's documentation about this](http://web.mit.edu/music21/doc/moduleReference/moduleHumdrum.html)).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
